title: Strictly's Kevin Clifton snubbed from tour as pro dancers are announced

Strictly Come Dancing's tour dancers have been announced for the upcoming 2020 tour - and fans will be disappointed not to see Kevin Clifton in the line up.

The pros are hitting the road for a tour in the summer of 2020, but there are several big names missing including fan favourite Kevin, 37.

However, Kevin's estranged wife Karen, who is still his performing partner on their own tours, is going off on the dates without him.

Also missing from the tour is AJ Pritchard, Aljaž Škorjanec, Anton Du Beke, Amy Dowden Giovanni Pernice and Janette Manrara.

A post on the official site reads: "Dust off your dancing shoes!...

(Image: PA)

(Image: BBC/Ray Burmiston)

"Fans up and down the UK will be thrilled to learn the line-up of dancers who will be bringing all the glitz and glamour to the live stage in the brand new 2020 Professionals Tour. Tickets are on sale now.

"Cha-cha-cha-ing their way around the UK will be no less than 10 of the incredibly popular and multi award-winning professional dancers from the 2019 Strictly Come Dancing BBC One series, in what promises to be another explosion of electrifying dance. "

(Image: BBC/Kieron McCarron)

Kevin and Karen my not be on the pro tour together after their split, but another estranged couple are hitting the road together - Neil and Katya Jones.

The couple's marriage broke down earlier this year, just months after Katya was caught on camera snogging her dance partner Seann Walsh.

Another fan favourite hitting the road is Dianne Buswell, who is sure to be a huge hit with audiences.

(Image: BBC/Ray Burmiston)

Other dancers in the line-up include Nadiya Bychkova, Graziano Di Prima, Oti Mabuse, Gorka Marquez, Luba Mushtuk and Johannes Radebe.

The tour features a gruelling schedule of 34 dates across the country, with many days featuring an evening performance and a matinee.

The shows kick off on May 7 at The Lowry in Salford, and will head to cities including London, Nottingham, Sheffield and Birmingham before ending in Edinburgh on June 4.
